oprah-winfrey.bio: Oprah Winfrey is an American media executive, actress, talk show host, television producer, and philanthropist. She is best known for her talk show, The Oprah Winfrey Show, broadcast from Chicago, which was the highest-rated television program of its kind in history.

bob-iger.bio: Robert Allen Iger is an American media executive and film producer who is Executive Chairman of The Walt Disney Company. He was CEO from 2005 to 2020.

books.title: Cashing in on the American Dream
books.author: Paul Terhorst

mark-cuban.bio: Mark Cuban is an American entrepreneur and investor. He is the owner of the National Basketball Association (NBA)'s Dallas Mavericks, co-owner of 2929 Entertainment, and chairman of AXS TV. He is also one of the main "shark" investors on the ABC reality television series, Shark Tank.

books.title: The Better Angels of Our Nature
books.author: Steven Pinker

books.title: Dealing with China
books.author: Henry M. Paulson Jr. & Michael K. Carroll

mark-zuckerberg.bio: Mark Zuckerberg is an American internet entrepreneur and philanthropist. He is known for co-founding and leading Facebook, Inc. and its namesake social networking website as its chairman, chief executive officer, and controlling shareholder.

books.author: Anne Frank

michelle-obama.bio: Michelle LaVaughn Robinson Obama is an American lawyer and author who was the first lady of the United States from 2009 to 2017. She is married to the 44th President of the United States Barack Obama. She is the first African-American First Lady of the United States.

jack-dorsey.bio: Jack Dorsey is an American computer programmer and Internet entrepreneur who is the co-founder and former CEO of Twitter, and the founder and CEO of Square, a mobile payments company.

martin-shkreli.bio: Martin Shkreli (Pharma Bro) is a former hedge fund manager from the United States. Shkreli is a co-founder of the hedge funds Elea Capital, MSMB Capital Management, and MSMB Healthcare; a co-founder and former CEO of the pharmaceutical companies Retrophin and Turing Pharmaceuticals (now Vyera Pharmaceuticals); and a former CEO of the start-up software business GÃ¶del Systems.

barack-obama.bio: Barack Obama is an American attorney and politician who served as the 44th president of the United States from 2009 to 2017. A member of the Democratic Party, he was the first African American president of the United States.

marc-andreessen.bio: Marc Andreessen is an American entrepreneur, investor, and software engineer. He is the co-author of Mosaic, the first widely used web browser; co-founder of Netscape; and co-founder and general partner of Silicon Valley venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz.

books.title: New Rules for the New Economy

seth-godin.bio: Seth Godin is the author of 18 books. He's also the founder of the online workshops altMBA and The Marketing Seminar. Godin has founded several companies, including Yoyodyne and Squidoo. In 2018, he was inducted into the Marketing Hall of Fame.

peter-thiel.bio: Peter Thiel is an American entrepreneur and venture capitalist. He is a co-founder of PayPal, Palantir Technologies and Founders Fund. He was ranked No. 328 on the Forbes 400 in 2018, with a net worth of $2.5 billion.

charlie-munger.bio: Charlie Munger is an American investor, businessman, former real estate attorney, and philanthropist. He is vice chairman of Berkshire Hathaway, the conglomerate controlled by Warren Buffett.

susan-wojcicki.bio: Susan Diane Wojcicki is an American technology executive. She has been the CEO of YouTube since February 2014. Wojcicki was involved in the founding of Google, and became Google's first marketing manager in 1999.

warren-buffett.bio: Warren Edward Buffett is an American business magnate, investor, and philanthropist, who is the chairman and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway. He is considered one of the most successful investors in the world and has a net worth of US$88.9 billion as of December 2019, making him the fourth-wealthiest person in the world.
